definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]

sentences.english: Nothing pleased my mother more than to be told how good were her dishes.
sentences.chinese: 夸母亲的菜做得多好，没什么比这更使她高兴的了。

sentences.english: I knew you would praise me.
The friend often sojourns , our home has boast quite of grade.
sentences.chinese: 朋友每每来作客，都夸我们家挺有品位的。

sentences.english: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.
sentences.chinese: 我若必须自夸，就夸那关乎我软弱的事便了。

sentences.english: Maybe she dresses well, is efficient or extremely punctual.
sentences.chinese: 比如，夸女孩衣着得体，办事有效率或者是极其守时。

sentences.english: She smiles when you praise her.
sentences.chinese: 每当你夸她的时候她就笑。

sentences.english: Pluto has a moon, called Charon, which is about the size of Quaoar itself.
sentences.chinese: 冥王星有一颗卫星，叫卡戎，和夸欧尔差不多大。

sentences.english: He bragged that he was the highest scorer.
sentences.chinese: 他夸他是最高的得分手。

sentences.english: No need to praise good color the fragrance spreads.
sentences.chinese: 不要人夸颜色好，只留香气满乾坤。

sentences.english: Comenius' ideas on art of teaching are very rich.
sentences.chinese: 夸美纽斯的教学艺术思想十分丰富。

sentences.english: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing?
sentences.chinese: 我们的盼望和喜乐，并所夸的冠冕，是什么呢。

sentences.english: She also said that Lisa was such a good girl who was very well-disciplined and well-behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她还夸我女儿懂事，说她是个很好的小姑娘。

sentences.english: Quaoar appears to be very similar in size and material.
sentences.chinese: 夸欧尔的大小和构成物质与它非常相似。

sentences.english: Though I never see him, my mother often praised he was a hardworking person.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我没见过这个叔叔，但偶尔能听到我妈夸他勤快。

sentences.english: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.
sentences.chinese: 我若必须自夸，就夸那关乎我软弱的事便了。

sentences.english: Hearing our praise, she smiled somewhat shyly.
sentences.chinese: 劳丽晴见我们夸她，有些羞涩地笑了笑。

definition: to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
